instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

instruction: If you are a doctor, please answer the medical questions based on the patient's description.

An electrocardiogram will help us in determining if your heart rhythm is normal. Lastly, we will perform an ultrasound to help us confirm the diagnosis. Hemoglobin A1c test can also be included in the blood test.

In order to confirm the diagnosis and to determine the best treatment options for you, we need to perform certain medical tests. You will first need to have a radiographic imaging procedure, followed by a Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan. We will also need to conduct other diagnostic procedures such as an interview, evaluation, and consultation. Depending on the severity of the condition, physical therapy exercises, other therapeutic nervous system procedures, and psychotherapy may be required. In certain cases, insertion, replacement, or removal of extracranial ventricular shunt may also be necessary.

Additionally, a Prothrombin time assay is essential to check for any blood-clotting disorders that may arise from this disease. Lastly, in severe cases, a corneal transplant may be necessary to restore vision loss. Based on your symptoms, we will determine which tests are required.
